pyhtp.quaternary package

Submodules

pyhtp.quaternary.scatter module

Define the scatter plot for quaternary phase diagram.

pyhtp.quaternary.scatter.scatter_quaternary(value: list[str | int] | ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]], label: tuple[str, str, str, str], database: XrdDatabase | None = None, coord: list[tuple[float, float, float, float]] | None = None, color: dict[str, str] | None = None, rotation: dict[str, float] | None = None, ticknum: int = 5, path_type: Literal['normal', 'snakelike'] = 'normal', composition_type: Literal['atomic', 'volumetric'] = 'atomic', ax: Axes3D | None = None, **kwargs) → None

Plot the quaternary scatter phase diagram.

Parameters:

  • value (Union[list[str | int], np.ndarray]) – The phase of each point.

  • label (tuple[str, str, str, str]) – The label of each element.

  • database (Optional[XrdDatabase], optional) – The XRD database. Defaults to None.

  • coord (Optional[list[tuple[float, float, float, float]]], optional) – The coordinates of each point. Defaults to None.

  • color (Optional[dict[str, str]], optional) – The color of each phase. Defaults to None.

  • rotation (Optional[dict[str, float]], optional) – The rotation of each phase. Defaults to None.

  • ticknum (int, optional) – The number of ticks on the edges. Defaults to 5.

  • path_type (Literal['normal', 'snakelike'], optional) – The type of path. Defaults to ‘normal’.

  • composition_type (Literal['atomic', 'volumetric'], optional) – The type of composition. Defaults to ‘atomic’.

  • ax (Optional[Axes3D], optional) – The axes. Defaults to None.

Raises:

TypeError – If the ax is not an instance of Axes3D.

pyhtp.quaternary.surf module

Define the surf plot for quaternary phase diagram.

pyhtp.quaternary.surf.surf_quaternary(coord: list[tuple[float, float, float, float]], value: list[float], label: tuple[str, str, str, str], ax: Axes3D | None = None, ticknum: int = 5, cmap: str = 'summer', path_type: Literal['normal', 'snakelike'] = 'normal', **kwargs) → tuple[Axes3D, Colorbar]

Plot the quaternary surface phase diagram.

Parameters:

  • coord (list[tuple[float, float, float, float]]) – Compositional coordinates of the points.

  • value (list[float]) – Values of the points.

  • label (tuple[str, str, str, str]) – Labels of the vertices.

  • ax (Optional[Axes3D], optional) – Defaults to None.

  • ticknum (int, optional) – Number of ticks on the edges. Defaults to 5.

  • cmap (str, optional) – Colormap. Defaults to ‘summer’.

  • path_type (Literal['normal', 'snakelike'], optional) – Path type. Defaults to ‘normal’.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for plot, such as fontfamily.

Returns:

The 3D axes.

Return type:

Axes

Raises:

TypeError – If the ax is not an instance of Axes3D.

pyhtp.quaternary.utils module

Define the utility functions for quaternary phase diagram.

pyhtp.quaternary.utils.get_coord(side_num: int, info: SampleInfo, composition_type: Literal['atomic', 'volumetric'] = 'atomic') → ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]]

Get the compositional coordinates of each point.

Parameters:

composition_type (Literal['atomic', 'volumetric'], optional) – The type of composition. Defaults to ‘atomic’.

Raises:

ValueError – Raise error if the type is invalid.

Returns:

The compositional coordinates of each point.

Return type:

np.ndarray

pyhtp.quaternary.utils.tet_to_car(vertices: ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]], coord: ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]]) → ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]]

Convert the tetrahedral coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.
